001/*

006
007package renderer.models_LP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011
012/**
013   Create a wireframe model of a cube with its center
014   at the origin, having edge length 2, and with its
015   corners at {@code (±1, ±1, ±1)}.
016<p>
017   This version of the cube model has each face of
018   the cube cut up by an n by m grid of lines.
019<p>
020   Here is a picture showing how the cube's eight
021   corners are labeled.
022<pre>{@code
023                  v4=(-1,1,-1)
024                  +---------------------+ v5=(1,1,-1)
025                 /|                    /|
026                / |                   / |
027               /  |                  /  |
028              /   |                 /   |
029             /    |                /    |
030         v7 +---------------------+ v6  |
031            |     |               |     |
032            |     |               |     |
033            |     | v0=(-1,-1,-1) |     |
034            |     +---------------|-----+ v1=(1,-1,-1)
035            |    /                |    /
036            |   /                 |   /
037            |  /                  |  /
038            | /                   | /
039            |/                    |/
040            +---------------------+
041            v3=(-1,-1,1)          v2=(1,-1,1)
042}</pre>
043
044   @see Cube
045   @see Cube3
046   @see Cube4
047*/
048public class Cube2 extends Model
049{
050   /**
051      Create a cube with its center at the origin, having edge
052      length 2, with its corners at {@code (±1, ±1, ±1)}. and
053      with two perpendicular grid lines going across the middle
054      of each of the cube's faces.
055   */
056   public Cube2( )
057   {
058      this(1, 1, 1);
059   }
060
061
062   /**
063      Create a cube with its center at the origin, having edge
064      length 2, with its corners at {@code (±1, ±1, ±1)}, and
065      with each of the cube's faces containing the given number
066      of grid lines parallel to the x, y, and z directions.
067
068      @param xGrid  number of grid lines perpendicular to the x-axis
069      @param yGrid  number of grid lines perpendicular to the y-axis
070      @param zGrid  number of grid lines perpendicular to the z-axis
071      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code xGrid} is less than 0
072      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code yGrid} is less than 0
073      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code zGrid} is less than 0
074   */
075   public Cube2(final int xGrid, final int yGrid, final int zGrid)
076   {
077      super("Cube2");
078
079      if (xGrid < 0)
080         throw new IllegalArgumentException("xGrid must be greater than or equal to 0");
081      if (yGrid < 0)
082         throw new IllegalArgumentException("yGrid must be greater than or equal to 0");
083      if (zGrid < 0)
084         throw new IllegalArgumentException("zGrid must be greater than or equal to 0");
085
086      final double xStep = 2.0 / (1 + xGrid),
087                   yStep = 2.0 / (1 + yGrid),
088                   zStep = 2.0 / (1 + zGrid);
089
090      // Grid lines perpendicular to the x-axis.
091      double x = -1.0;
092      for (int i = 0; i <= xGrid + 1; ++i)
093      {
094         final int start = vertexList.size();
095
096         // Start at the top, front edge, go down the front face, and around the cube.
097         double y = 1.0;
098         for (int j = 0; j <= yGrid; ++j)
099         {
100            addVertex( new Vertex(x, y, 1.0) );
101            y -= yStep;
102         }
103         double z = 1.0;
104         for (int j = 0; j <= zGrid; ++j)
105         {
106            addVertex( new Vertex(x, -1.0, z) );
107            z -= zStep;
108         }
109         y = -1.0;
110         for (int j = 0; j <= yGrid; ++j)
111         {
112            addVertex( new Vertex(x, y, -1.0) );
113            y += yStep;
114         }
115         z = -1.0;
116         for (int j = 0; j <= zGrid; ++j)
117         {
118            addVertex( new Vertex(x, 1.0, z) );
119            z += zStep;
120         }
121         final int stop = vertexList.size();
122         // Note: stop - start =  2*yGrid + 2*zGrid + 4
123
124         final LineLoop lineLoop = new LineLoop();
125
126         for (int j = start; j < stop; ++j)
127         {
128            lineLoop.addIndex( j );
129         }
130
131         addPrimitive(lineLoop);
132
133         x += xStep;
134      }
135
136      // Grid lines perpendicular to the y-axis.
137      double y = -1.0;
138      for (int i = 0; i <= yGrid + 1; ++i)
139      {
140         final int start = vertexList.size();
141
142         // Start at the front, right edge, go left across the front face, and around the cube.
143         double x2 = 1.0;
144         for (int j = 0; j <= xGrid; ++j)
145         {
146            addVertex( new Vertex(x2, y, 1.0) );
147            x2 -= xStep;
148         }
149         double z = 1.0;
150         for (int j = 0; j <= zGrid; ++j)
151         {
152            addVertex( new Vertex(-1.0, y, z) );
153            z -= zStep;
154         }
155         x2 = -1.0;
156         for (int j = 0; j <= xGrid; ++j)
157         {
158            addVertex( new Vertex(x2, y, -1.0) );
159            x2 += xStep;
160         }
161         z = -1.0;
162         for (int j = 0; j <= zGrid; ++j)
163         {
164            addVertex( new Vertex(1.0, y, z) );
165            z += zStep;
166         }
167         final int stop = vertexList.size();
168         // Note: stop - start =  2*xGrid + 2*zGrid + 4
169
170         final LineLoop lineLoop = new LineLoop();
171
172         for (int j = start; j < stop; ++j)
173         {
174            lineLoop.addIndex( j );
175         }
176
177         addPrimitive(lineLoop);
178
179         y += yStep;
180      }
181
182      // Grid lines perpendicular to the z-axis.
183      double z = -1.0;
184      for (int i = 0; i <= zGrid + 1; ++i)
185      {
186         final int start = vertexList.size();
187
188         // Start at the top, right edge, go left across the top face, and around the cube.
189         double x2 = 1.0;
190         for (int j = 0; j <= xGrid; ++j)
191         {
192            addVertex( new Vertex(x2, 1.0, z) );
193            x2 -= xStep;
194         }
195         double y2 = 1.0;
196         for (int j = 0; j <= yGrid; ++j)
197         {
198            addVertex( new Vertex(-1.0, y2, z) );
199            y2 -= yStep;
200         }
201         x2 = -1.0;
202         for (int j = 0; j <= xGrid; ++j)
203         {
204            addVertex( new Vertex(x2, -1.0, z) );
205            x2 += xStep;
206         }
207         y2 = -1.0;
208         for (int j = 0; j <= yGrid; ++j)
209         {
210            addVertex( new Vertex(1.0, y2, z) );
211            y2 += yStep;
212         }
213         final int stop = vertexList.size();
214         // Note: stop - start =  2*xGrid + 2*yGrid + 4
215
216         final LineLoop lineLoop = new LineLoop();
217
218         for (int j = start; j < stop; ++j)
219         {
220            lineLoop.addIndex( j );
221         }
222
223         addPrimitive(lineLoop);
224
225         z += zStep;
226      }
227   }
228}//Cube2
